formattedAddress: 60 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 60 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011-8307, USA

editorialSummary.text: Stylish, relaxed restaurant serving regional specialties from Southern India, plus cocktails and wine.

originalText.text:
Such delicious food.
Went here with high expectations and they were certainly met.
My partner even called it one of the top 5 meals of his life!

We had the sprouting bean starter, which was an excellent, light way to start our meal. Also tried the snails, lamb, lobster, and the gunpowder dosa.

All of it was incredible. And the server was so kind to offer suggestions.

If all the food - I think you can skip the lobster. It‚Äôs pricey and looking back I should have done a more adventurous Indian dish.

Bravo, Semma!

originalText.text: Great food, absolutely worth the hype. The oxtail and Gunpowder dosa are a must. We also got the duck leg entree- it was really good but it had a very similar sauce as the oxtail. If we go again, we‚Äôd probably replace the duck leg just for the sake of variety. Cocktails were also great. Note: the food is spicy and reservations are hard to get!

text.text: Great food, absolutely worth the hype. The oxtail and Gunpowder dosa are a must. We also got the duck leg entree- it was really good but it had a very similar sauce as the oxtail. If we go again, we‚Äôd probably replace the duck leg just for the sake of variety. Cocktails were also great. Note: the food is spicy and reservations are hard to get!

originalText.text: Semma is a true culinary gem! The menu is a delightful fusion of flavors, with each dish crafted to perfection. The freshness of ingredients and creative combinations make dining here an extraordinary experience. The attention to detail is evident in every bite, showcasing the chef's expertise. The ambiance is inviting and the staff is warm and attentive, adding to the overall charm. Whether you're a food enthusiast or simply looking for a memorable dining experience, Semma is a must-visit. Prepare your taste buds for a journey of exquisite flavors and indulge in the stellar offerings this restaurant has to offer!

text.text: Semma is a true culinary gem! The menu is a delightful fusion of flavors, with each dish crafted to perfection. The freshness of ingredients and creative combinations make dining here an extraordinary experience. The attention to detail is evident in every bite, showcasing the chef's expertise. The ambiance is inviting and the staff is warm and attentive, adding to the overall charm. Whether you're a food enthusiast or simply looking for a memorable dining experience, Semma is a must-visit. Prepare your taste buds for a journey of exquisite flavors and indulge in the stellar offerings this restaurant has to offer!

originalText.text:
Truly blown away by the incredible food and vibes at Semma! Love their take on Indian food and how much thought and care goes into each dish.

Food
I ordered three things off the menu as a solo diner and was stuffed afterwards. To start, the gunpowder dosa was honestly my favorite dish of the night. The portion is humongous and it comes with 3 sauces to dip into. It can get on the spicy side but I like it that way and everything about this was amazing. For an entree I tried the lobster tail. While the meat was generous and good, it wasn‚Äôt as tender as I expected. However the sauce the lobster comes with was so tasty that I wiped the plate clean. For dessert I recommend the passion fruit pudding, it came intricately plated and tasted very refreshing.

Service
Everyone was so kind and friendly and I could tell enjoyed working here. The bartenders / servers were attentive and nice to talk to.

Restaurant
Coming in without a reservation, I showed up at opening to grab a seat at the bar which is just as great as a table. The entire restaurant has a cozy vibe to it with clean decor and thoughtful touches.

Glad I finally got to check this place off my list!

originalText.text: Excellent South Indian food! The lobster is to die for and dosa is just too good to be true! Definitely try the Peconic snails and all the drinks on the menu! You do need a reservation, even to sit at the bar üç∏
